summary: Completed comprehensive testing of cloned GUESSIT project. Core frontend and backend infrastructure working correctly. Authentication, UI components, and navigation all functional. Main issue is missing Football API key preventing match data display.

critical_bugs.issue: Returns 0 matches due to missing FOOTBALL_API_KEY environment variable
critical_bugs.impact: No match data displayed on frontend, core app functionality limited
critical_bugs.details: Football-Data.org API returning 403 error: 'You reached your request limit. Get your free API token to use the API extensively.'

configuration_issues.impact: Admin panel not accessible for testing

configuration_issues.issue: WebSocket endpoints returning 404/200 instead of expected 405
configuration_issues.impact: Live updates may not work properly

integration_issues.issue: Sometimes persists briefly on direct page navigation to /login and /register
integration_issues.impact: Slight UX delay but clears automatically

passed_tests: Backend health endpoint (/api/health) returns healthy status
Homepage loads correctly with GUESSIT branding
Promo banner displays ('Track Your Stats!' content)
League filters present (All Matches, Live, UCL, Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, Bundesliga, Ligue 1)
Navigation tabs working (Popular, Top Live, Soon, Ended)
Header navigation shows Login and Register buttons
Footer component rendered with GUESSIT branding
Login page loads with functional form (email, password, Google auth)
Register page loads with functional form (email, password, confirm password, Google auth)
User registration and authentication flow working
action_item_for_main_agent: Add FOOTBALL_API_KEY environment variable to /app/backend/.env to enable match data fetching from football-data.org API. Current API calls are failing with 403 due to missing/invalid API key. Also update admin login credentials if admin panel testing is required.
success_percentage: Backend: 75% (12/16 tests passed), Frontend: 90% (UI working, match data missing due to backend API key issue)
